passage:
(1) The heart is a powerful muscular organ that serves as the central pump of the circulatory system. Located in the chest between the lungs, this fist-sized organ beats approximately 100,000 times per day, pumping about 7,500 liters of blood throughout the body. The heart is divided into four chambers: two upper chambers called atria and two lower chambers called ventricles. A wall of muscle called the septum separates the left and right sides of the heart, preventing oxygen-rich blood from mixing with oxygen-poor blood.

(2) The primary function of the heart is to maintain a continuous circulation of blood throughout the body. This circulation delivers essential oxygen and nutrients to all cells while removing waste products such as carbon dioxide. The heart performs this vital function through a coordinated sequence of contractions and relaxations that moves blood in a one-way flow through the circulatory system. This rhythmic pumping action is controlled by electrical signals that originate from a natural pacemaker called the sinoatrial node, located in the right atrium.

(3) Blood circulation follows a specific pathway through the heart and body. First, oxygen-depleted blood returns from the body through large veins called the superior and inferior vena cavae, entering the right atrium. The blood then flows through the tricuspid valve into the right ventricle. When the heart contracts, this blood is pumped through the pulmonary valve into the pulmonary arteries, which carry it to the lungs where it releases carbon dioxide and absorbs oxygen. The newly oxygenated blood then returns to the heart through the pulmonary veins, entering the left atrium.

(4) From the left atrium, the oxygen-rich blood passes through the mitral valve into the left ventricle, which is the heart's most powerful chamber. When the left ventricle contracts, it forces the blood through the aortic valve into the aorta, the body's largest artery. From there, the blood travels through a network of increasingly smaller arteries and arterioles until it reaches the capillaries, where the exchange of oxygen, nutrients, and waste products occurs at the cellular level. After this exchange, the oxygen-depleted blood returns to the heart through venules and veins, completing the cycle.

(5) The heart's ability to function properly is essential for overall health. Various factors can affect heart performance, including diet, exercise, stress, and hereditary conditions. Heart disease remains one of the leading causes of death worldwide, often resulting from lifestyle factors such as poor diet, lack of exercise, smoking, and excessive alcohol consumption. Regular physical activity, a balanced diet, stress management, and routine medical check-ups can help maintain heart health and prevent cardiovascular problems. Medical advances have also provided treatments for many heart conditions, including medications, surgical procedures, and implantable devices that can help the heart function more effectively.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'If she _____ harder, she would have passed the exam.'
Select the correct relative pronoun: 'The man _____ car was stolen called the police.'
Which sentence contains a correctly used modal verb?

options.A: She must to go to the doctor yesterday.
options.B: You shouldn't to eat so much sugar.
options.C: He might be late for the meeting.
options.D: They could going to the party tomorrow.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the reported speech: 'I will call you tomorrow,' she said.

options.A: She said she will call me tomorrow.
options.B: She said she would call me the next day.
options.C: She said I will call you tomorrow.
options.D: She said she will call me the next day.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of the present perfect tense:

options.A: I have seen that movie last week.
options.B: She has lived in Paris for three years.
options.C: They have finished the project yesterday.
options.D: He has gone to the store since two hours.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct form of the passive voice?

options.A: The book was writing by a famous author.
options.B: The house is being painted by the workers.
options.D: The letter is send last week.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the article: 'She plays _____ violin in _____ orchestra.'

options.A: This book is more interesting than that one.
options.B: She is more taller than her sister.
options.C: The blue car is more faster than the red one.
options.D: This exercise is more easier than I expected.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'Everyone in the room _____ when the fire alarm went off.'
Which sentence uses the future continuous correctly?

options.A: I will studying English next year.
options.B: She will be visit her parents tomorrow.
options.C: They will working at six o'clock.
options.D: He will be playing tennis at this time tomorrow.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of quantifiers:

options.A: There are a few sand on the beach.
options.B: She has a little books on her shelf.
options.C: He drinks a lot of water every day.
options.D: We need a few money for the trip.

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She arrived _____ the airport _____ midnight.'
Which sentence has the correct word order?

options.A: Always she arrives early to class.
options.B: She early arrives always to class.
options.C: She always arrives early to class.
options.D: She arrives always early to class.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of gerunds and infinitives:

options.A: She enjoys to swim in the lake.
options.B: I look forward to seeing you soon.
options.C: They decided going to the movies.

questions.question: Choose the correctly punctuated sentence:

options.A: When, it rains the streets get wet.
options.B: When it rains, the streets get wet.
options.C: When it rains the streets, get wet.
options.D: When it, rains the streets get wet.

questions.question: Choose the correct phrasal verb: 'Can you _____ the children while I go to the store?'
Select the correct expression to show disagreement:

options.C: I'm afraid I don't agree with you.

questions.question: Choose the correct collocation:
Which expression is used to make a suggestion?

options.B: How about going to the beach?

questions.question: Select the correct linking phrase to show contrast:

Which phrase is used to express gratitude?

Which expression is correct to ask for clarification?

options.A: Sorry, I didn't catch that. Could you repeat it?
options.B: I don't know what you're talking about.

questions.question: What does it mean to 'regret' something?

options.A: To feel happy about a decision
options.B: To feel sorry about something you did or didn't do

questions.question: Which word means to combine different things together?
What is a 'zone'?

options.A: A specific area with particular characteristics

questions.question: Which sentence uses the word 'shift' correctly?

options.A: I like to shift my breakfast.
options.B: She will shift to a new apartment next month.

questions.question: What does it mean to give someone 'advice'?

options.C: To tell them what you think they should do

questions.question: Choose the word that means to speak very loudly:
What does it mean to 'perform'?

options.A: To act, sing, or play music for an audience

questions.question: Which definition best describes the word 'land' as a verb?

options.A: To arrive on the ground after being in the air

questions.question: What does it mean to 'update' something?

options.C: To bring it up to date with new information

questions.question: Which of the following is the best definition of 'stage'?

options.B: A platform where performances take place

questions.question: Choose the sentence that uses the word 'possible' correctly:

options.A: Is it possible that we will finish on time?
options.B: She possible went to the store.
options.D: I possible like chocolate ice cream.

questions.question: What does it mean to say something 'exists'?

options.C: It is alive or present in reality

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'require'?
What does it mean to 'refer' to something?

options.C: To mention or talk about it

questions.question: Which sentence uses the word 'suppose' correctly?

options.A: I suppose my keys on the table.
options.B: Can you suppose this bag for me?
options.C: I suppose we should leave soon.

questions.question: According to paragraph 1, where is the heart located?

options.D: To the right of the lungs

questions.question: How many chambers does the heart have?
What is the function of the septum in the heart?

options.A: To pump blood through the body
options.B: To separate oxygen-rich blood from oxygen-poor blood
options.C: To control the heart's electrical signals
options.D: To connect the atria to the ventricles

questions.question: According to paragraph 2, what is the primary function of the heart?

options.A: To filter waste products from the blood
options.B: To produce oxygen for the body
options.C: To maintain a continuous circulation of blood

questions.question: What controls the rhythmic pumping action of the heart?
According to the passage, where does the oxygen-depleted blood enter the heart?
Which chamber of the heart is described as the most powerful?
Where does the exchange of oxygen, nutrients, and waste products occur?
According to paragraph 5, which of the following can affect heart performance?

options.D: Diet, exercise, stress, and hereditary conditions

questions.question: What is the main idea of the passage?

options.A: Heart disease is a leading cause of death worldwide.
options.B: The heart pumps blood through a specific pathway in the body.
options.C: The heart's function and role in the circulatory system.
options.D: Medical advances have improved treatments for heart conditions.
